glossaryid.title: ANTIGEN
glossaryid.paragraph: Any entity that is capable of triggering an immune response.<sup>18</sup>

glossaryid.title: EXCIPIENTS
glossaryid.paragraph: Substances added to a medicine for ease of proper shaping and consistency; the vehicle for the drug.<sup>19</sup>

glossaryid.title: MALAISE
glossaryid.paragraph: Feeling of discomfort, weakness or fatigue.<sup>18</sup>

glossaryid.title: PROPHYLAXIS
glossaryid.paragraph: Prevention of a disease or of a process that can lead to disease.<sup>18</sup>

glossaryid.title: REYEâ€™S SYNDROME
glossaryid.paragraph: Syndrome characterised by acute encephalopathy and fatty infiltration of the liver, pancreas, heart, spleen and lymph nodes. It occurs in children aged <19 years following an acute viral infection. Generally associated with the increased use of salicylates (aspirin) in children during or following viral infection.<sup>19</sup>
